edu.gcu.web.service

Class RestService

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gcu.web.service.RestService

  • @Path(value="weather")
public class RestService
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is REST Service that implements the REST API to support the Weather Sensor IoT.

      RestService()

      • test

@Path(value="/test")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public ResponseModel test()

        Response Model

      • saveTemperatureSensorData

        @POST
@Path(value="/save")
@Consumes(value="application/json")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public ResponseModel saveTemperatureSensorData(WeatherSensorModel model)
        Save Sensor Data API at /save using HTTP POST.
        Parameters:
        model - The Weather Data to save.
        Returns:
        Response Model with error code of 1 for no error, 0 if save failed, -2 if database error

      • getTemperatureSensorDataInRange

        @GET
@Path(value="/get/{device}/{from}/{to}")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public ResponseDataModel getTemperatureSensorDataInRange(@PathParam(value="device")
                                                                  int deviceID,
                                                                  @PathParam(value="from")
                                                                  java.lang.String from,
                                                                  @PathParam(value="to")
                                                                  java.lang.String to)
        Get Sensor Data in a Date Range at /get/{device}/YYYY-MM-dd HH:mm:ss using HTTP GET.
        Parameters:
        deviceID - Device ID to query Sensor Data from
        from - Start date and time to query where format is YYYY-MM-dd HH:mm:ss
        to - End date and time to query where format is YYYY-MM-dd HH:mm:ss
        Returns:
        Response Model with error code of 0 for no error, -1 if no sensor data found, -2 if database error, -3 if input data parsing error

      • getTemperatureSensorData

        @GET
@Path(value="/get/{device}/{id}")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public ResponseDataModel getTemperatureSensorData(@PathParam(value="device")
                                                           int deviceID,
                                                           @PathParam(value="id")
                                                           int id)
        Get Sensor Data for a specified Sensor Device ID at /get/{device}/{id} using HTTP GET.
        Parameters:
        deviceID - Device ID to query Sensor Data from
        id - Sensor ID to return
        Returns:
        Response Model with error code of 0 for no error, -1 if no sensor data found, -2 if database error

      • setService

        public void setService(WeatherServiceInterface service)
        IoC helper function.
        Parameters:
        service - WeatherServiceInterface to inject into this service implementation.
